AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: AI/automation prematurely concluded “likely hardware/storage failure” and drove an RMA path, but internal team later stated the issue is a known driver problem resolved by a specific build (v10:9072), making the earlier analysis and RMA push factually wrong/misleading. The customer was also given a broken/placeholder upload link.
evidence: “Behavior consistent with storage/boot media failure.”
“This qualifies as an obvious hardware/storage failure in the context of our workflow, so we skip additional diagnostics.”
“RMA is NOT approved. ... stems from driver issues and was resolved in v10:9072”
“share a direct downloadable link [/URL_FOR_VIDEO]”

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: Customer repeatedly pushed to get a ticket/RMA while AI kept gating progress on additional artifacts (video/serial photo) and re-asking despite the customer stating the data was already provided/uploaded, creating a loop/friction before action.
evidence: Customer: “Please create me a ticket”
Customer: “Create me a ticket we aleready have all data you need”
Customer: “Video uploaded”
Support: “To proceed further, we require... 1) A video recording...”
Customer: “We aleready tried it and it dosent work”

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support asked for diagnostics/logs even though the device is non-booting and the customer already said recovery attempts failed; also re-requested video after the customer indicated it was uploaded (suggesting failure to recognize/locate provided info).
evidence: Customer: “The firewall dosent boot i get a error message from ubuntu”
Customer: “We aleready tried it and it dosent work”
Support: “Additionally, if your unit manages to boot sufficiently, please provide the diagnostic logs...”
Customer: “Video uploaded”
Support: “we require... 1) A video recording demonstrating the boot process...”

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: All interactions shown occur within the same day and within minutes/hours; no >2-day customer-to-support gap is visible.

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: The ticket is not shown as closed; instead it is placed on hold awaiting warranty/RMA approval, and no closure occurs while the customer is waiting in the provided excerpt.
evidence: “Placing on hold for 48 hour(s)”
“We will update you as soon as we receive their confirmation...”

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: This is a critical outage (firewall won’t boot; ticket set to URGENT), yet the handling defaulted into an RMA workflow and assumptions of hardware failure without first aligning to known/communicated software fix guidance; internal team explicitly notes this was a known driver issue and that CS should have had this in process.
evidence: “Set priority to URGENT as this is a hardware outage preventing the firewall from booting.”
Customer: “My Kerio NG120 wont start any more it crashes while booting”

“RMA is NOT approved... stems from driver issues and was resolved in v10:9072 ... I have informed about this fact in CS-BU g-chat on NOV 4th - can you please confirm this info has made it to your processes?”
